						<h1 id="firstHeading" class="firstHeading" lang="en"><span dir="auto">Lenovo</span></h1>
			<div id="bodyContent">
								<div id="siteSub">From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia</div>
								<div id="contentSub"></div>
												<div id="jump-to-nav" class="mw-jump">
					Jump to:					<a href="#mw-navigation">navigation</a>, 					<a href="#p-search">search</a>
				</div>
				<div id="mw-content-text" lang="en" dir="ltr" class="mw-content-ltr"><p><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Use_mdy_dates&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Use mdy dates (page does not exist)">Template:Use mdy dates</a>
{{#invoke:Infobox|infobox}}
<a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Chinese&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Chinese (page does not exist)">Template:Chinese</a>
<b>Lenovo Group Ltd.</b> is a Chinese <a href="/wiki/Multinational_corporation" title="Multinational corporation">multinational</a> technology company with headquarters in <a href="/w/index.php?title=Beijing&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Beijing (page does not exist)">Beijing</a>, <a href="/wiki/China" title="China">China</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Morrisville,_North_Carolina" title="Morrisville, North Carolina">Morrisville, North Carolina</a>, <a href="/w/index.php?title=United_States&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="United States (page does not exist)">United States</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-lenovo_1-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-lenovo-1">[1]</a></sup> It designs, develops, manufactures and sells personal computers, <a href="/w/index.php?title=Tablet_computers&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Tablet computers (page does not exist)">tablet computers</a>, <a href="/w/index.php?title=Lenovo_smartphones&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Lenovo smartphones (page does not exist)">smartphones</a>, <a href="/wiki/Workstations" title="Workstations" class="mw-redirect">workstations</a>, <a href="/wiki/Server_(computing)" title="Server (computing)">servers</a>, electronic storage devices, IT management software and <a href="/w/index.php?title=Smart_TV&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Smart TV (page does not exist)">smart televisions</a>. In the second quarter of 2013 Lenovo was the <a href="/w/index.php?title=Market_share_of_personal_computer_vendors&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Market share of personal computer vendors (page does not exist)">world's largest personal computer vendor</a> by unit sales.<sup id="cite_ref-gartner20130114pr_2-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-gartner20130114pr-2">[2]</a></sup> It markets the <a href="/wiki/ThinkPad" title="ThinkPad">ThinkPad</a> line of notebook computers and the <a href="/wiki/ThinkCentre" title="ThinkCentre">ThinkCentre</a> line of desktops.<sup id="cite_ref-owen2011_3-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-owen2011-3">[3]</a></sup>
</p><p>Lenovo has operations in more than 60 countries and sells its products in around 160 countries. Lenovo's principal facilities are in Beijing, Morrisville and Singapore, with research centers in those locations, as well as Shanghai, Shenzhen, Xiamen, and Chengdu in China, and Yamato in Kanagawa Prefecture, Japan. It operates a joint venture with <a href="/wiki/EMC_Corporation" title="EMC Corporation">EMC</a>, LenovoEMC, which sells <a href="/wiki/Network_attached_storage" title="Network attached storage" class="mw-redirect">network attached storage</a> solutions. It also has a joint venture with <a href="/wiki/NEC" title="NEC">NEC</a>, Lenovo NEC Holdings, which produces personal computers for the Japanese market. 
</p><p>Lenovo was founded in Beijing in 1984 as <b>Legend</b> and was incorporated in <a href="/wiki/Hong_Kong" title="Hong Kong">Hong Kong</a> in 1988. Lenovo acquired <a href="/w/index.php?title=IBM&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="IBM (page does not exist)">IBM</a>'s personal computer business in 2005 and agreed to acquire its Intel-based server business in 2014. Lenovo entered the smartphone market in 2012 and as of 2014 is the largest vendor of smartphones in Mainland China. In January 2014, Lenovo agreed to acquire the mobile phone handset maker <a href="/w/index.php?title=Motorola_Mobility&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Motorola Mobility (page does not exist)">Motorola Mobility</a> from <a href="/wiki/Google" title="Google">Google</a>.
</p><p>Lenovo is listed on the <a href="/wiki/Hong_Kong_Stock_Exchange" title="Hong Kong Stock Exchange">Hong Kong Stock Exchange</a> and is a constituent of the <a href="/w/index.php?title=Hang_Seng_China-Affiliated_Corporations_Index&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Hang Seng China-Affiliated Corporations Index (page does not exist)">Hang Seng China-Affiliated Corporations Index</a>, often referred to as "Red Chips".
<a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:TOC_limit&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:TOC limit (page does not exist)">Template:TOC limit</a>
</p>
